casename: Merck & Co, Inc v Pharmaforte Singapore Pte Ltd
coram: Chao Hick Tin JA; L P Thean JA; Yong Pung How CJ
counsel: P Sivakumar and Vicki Heng (Ella Cheong & G Mirandah) for the appellants; Ranvir Kumar Singh and Vivienne Kaur (Kumar & Loh) for the respondents
tags-parsed: Patents and Inventions/Novelty/Lack of utility in invention/Registered patent comprising Lovastatin/Allegation that Apo-Lovastatin infringes patent comprising Lovastatin/Definition of "utility"/Whether lack of utility renders invention unpatentable for want of novelty/Whether differences in degree of compound patentable/Whether invention anticipated by prior art

Patents and Inventions/Inventive step/Whether invention obvious to person skilled in the art/Whether mere discovery patentable/Whether person skilled in the art could use existing standard techniques to purify Lovastatin
